attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for new Vehicles to have automatic emergency braking
attributes.background: To help prevent accidents and deaths on the road by making it a legal requirement for new cars, vans and trucks to have automatic emergency braking systems

attributes.action: Increase the Teacher Training Bursuries for Core subjects and Primary Education.
attributes.background: The teacher training bursury for Biology has been slashed by £5000 since last year and is unacceptable. Biology is a core subject and should be treated with the same respect as Chemistry and Physics. To take away from the bursury will only push teachers to leave and teach abroad.
attributes.additional_details: The teacher training bursury is given to students hoping to become either primary or secondary school teachers, it is used to help pay their course fees of £9000 and their living expenses for the year as they do not recieve pay even though they will be working full time. Subjects that require specialism recieve a larger bursury. Biology is not an easy subject and is a core subject throughout young people's time In education and should be given the same bursury as chemistry and physics.

attributes.action: Government must do more to help councils build more council homes
attributes.background: The lack of affordable housing is a chronic problem, and has got worse as years have gone on. I became disabled due to a fall at work, and am now in wheelchair. I suffer with chronic pain. I'm stuck in a first floor flat have been trying for years to get a bungalow or ground floor flat with no luck.

attributes.action: let Pubs And clubs to sell THC Infused Drinks as a safer alternative to Alcohol
attributes.background:
Amend the misuse of Drugs act  and Psychoactive Substance Bill To allow Pubs And clubs to sell THC Infused Drinks as a safer alternative to Alcohol.
I Believe this will reduce the level of drink related crime and is well known to be much less physically harmful than alcohol

attributes.action: Make retesting of all road users compulsory every 5 years to ensure road safety.
attributes.background: With road deaths increased in 2014 by 4% from 2013 to 1775, serious road injuries increasing by 5% in 2014 from 2013 to 22807 and the total of 194,477 casualties of all severities in reported road traffic accidents during 2014 retesting of road users is essential to protecting the roads.
attributes.additional_details: http://tinyurl.com/nkzmbzh shows the evidence. What is proposed is that road users be charged for the retest. If they pass the test they are refunded the entire test fee as they are competent, if they fail they revert to a provisional licence and have to retrain similar to learners. This makes roads safer (priority), increases employment within the DVSA (better for workforce), provides additional income source which can be put on improving the road network in the UK. Winners all round.

attributes.action: Make distribution of junk mail a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
I, like many other UK householders, feel constantly harassed by the large volume of junk mail being posted to me on a daily basis. 

Please support this petition to ban the distribution of unaddressed and unsolicited mail and make this form of nuisance a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: Benefits of this proposal include both an enhanced quality of life for all UK householders suffering harassment at the hands of junk mail distributors and a reduction in waste material resulting in environmental savings.

attributes.action: Enact legislation to protect the misuse of pension funds.
attributes.background:
Require due diligence in the management of the funds.
Enable beneficiaries to stop proposals.
Make firms and individuals financially responsible for negligent management and allow recovery of mismanaged monies.
attributes.additional_details:
BHS, Bernard Matthews and a host of other firms and organisations have shown the ease by which honest British subjects can have their futures blighted towards the end of their working lives by either greed or incompetence of those controlling their pension funds.
We must ensure the funds people have built up over decades are protected and recoverable.

attributes.action: A legislation to prevent all retailers in UK selling clothes made in sweatshops
attributes.background: Sweatshops are work enviroments like a factory/shop where employees work long hours,low wages,unhealthy working conditions.This is why we want a calling for legislation to prevent all retailers in the uk from selling products(e.g.clothing)which have been made in sweatshops.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a big issue in today's society,which needs to be resolved immediately.Many are forced to work 14-16 hours a day,seven days a week.On top of this workers face unsafe,cramped and hazardous conditions which often lead to work injuries and factory fires.In all the countries that have sweatshops an estimate of 250 million kids inbetween the ages of 5-14 do hard labour.
Many people work in sweatshops because they need to provide for their family and many of them have no idea they are being exploited.So help and support us in this to create a change in the world we live in.

attributes.action: Ask the UN to investigate the gay purge in Chechnya and to take action if needed
attributes.background: It has recently been brought to light by investigative journalists that the Chechen government could be implicated in the detention, torture and murder of homosexuals in the region. We ask that the UN investigate and take harsh measures against the Chechen government if found to be complicit
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/meps-demand-theresa-may-take-swift-action-against-abhorrent-concentration-camps-for-gay-men_uk_58ee19a6e4b0c89f9122fe98

https://www.indy100.com/article/russia-gay-purge-chechnya-concentration-camp-detention-illegal-torture-7676861

attributes.action: Scrap Best Before Dates for all food items in the UK
attributes.background: The UK consumer throws away 7.2 million tonnes of food a year. One of the reasons that contributes to this is the confusion between the "Best Before Date", "Use by" and "Expiry Date". The "Best Before Date" refers to quality — Foods will be safe to eat after the best before date.
attributes.additional_details: The average family spend up to £700 per year on wasted food which is thrown away due to the food item being past its "Best Before Date". Many consumers maybe aware of the difference however a vast number of consumers are still tuned to following the date listed on the item. Therefore we want it to be made easier with no room for confusion with the scrappage of the "Best Before" label.

attributes.action: Make Cronh's, Colitis and IBD a disability recognised in the Equality Act 2010
attributes.background:
Thousands of people suffer from this disabling condition nationwide,
Employers need to realise that people are living with this invisible medical condition are suffering yet continue to work, staff should not be discriminated against, let's get this condition recognised as a disability today
attributes.additional_details:
It’s estimated that UC affects about one in every 420 people in the UK (roughly 146,000 people).
Ulcerative Colitis is a very individual condition and its symptoms will vary from person to person. They range from mild to severe and may also change over time.
 The most common symptoms are:
• Diarrhoea
• Cramping pains in the abdomen
• Tiredness and fatigue
• Feeling generally unwell or feverish
• Loss of appetite and weight loss
• Anaemia (a reduced level of red blood cells).

attributes.action: I propose that the government should pay for otter fences around fisheries.
attributes.background: It is becoming widely known that commercial fisheries and national river fishery stocks are being attacked by otters. Peoples livelihoods are at stake and as fishing is the largest participated sport in Britain I feel our sport is in jeopardy.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://www.wiltsglosstandard.co.uk/
A link hi lighting the problem.

attributes.action: Ban "let by" signs from being put up outside houses/flats anywhere in the UK
attributes.background: Most letting agents are ignoring 14 day rule.
attributes.additional_details:
The signs are an eyesore and make neighbourhoods undesirable.Many signs are left up permanently, despite the law saying they should be removed after 14 days of a tenancy being granted.
Many of the signs remain in place all-year-round despite properties being tenanted and only serve as advertising for rental companies

attributes.action: Red Tractor accreditation should require open air grazing.
attributes.background: Currently, the Red Tractor standard ensures livestock is reared "adequately" which is commendable, however the requirements do not include open air or grass fields for grazing.
attributes.additional_details: In reality, the Red Tractor standard is not much more than basic battery farming. The undersigned, and conscious meat eaters, request that the welfare of livestock is significantly improved by requiring open air grass field grazing to achieve the Red Tractor standard

attributes.action: Regulate & legalize MDMA. Drugs will always be taken, let's make it safer.
attributes.background: We know the safety profile for pure MDMA, yet due to it's illegal status, users of street MDMA run the risk of taking impure compounds that can be very dangerous and cause death. If MDMA is regulated we can be aware of dosage, frequency of consumption and have a pure drug not supplied by criminals.

attributes.action: Remove the 'Real Life Experience' time from the offensive GRC for trans people
attributes.background: Remove the waiting time of 24 months of 'Real Life Experience' from the already offensive Gender Recognition Certificate for people who are transitioning.
attributes.additional_details:
The requirement is to have been living as your intended gender for 24 months before a panel of strangers get to decide if you're a 'real man' or a 'real woman'. This in itself is already deeply offensive but to then have to wait 2 years for the privilege is just wrong. 

If the concept of the GRC has to be kept, there should be better criteria, such as an official change of name (deed poll) and/or a referral to a Gender Identity Clinic.

attributes.action: Cap credit card, loans and catalogue companies from charging high APR
attributes.background: Credit card companies are charge APR as high as 59.9%, we have shops on the high street charging higher, then we have advertisements of pay day loans, provident. these high interest charges are just going to get more people in debt, which results in bankruptcy so the tax pay foots the bill.

attributes.action: Provide additional national funding for Tier 2 social housing.
attributes.background: Homelessness affects towns and cities up and down the UK. Although we need more affordable housing options generally, Tier 2 (shared housing with support) is needed, in particular, so that the homeless can progress forwards from emergency help in Tier 1, and from Tier 2 begin to restore their lives.
attributes.additional_details: There has been a lack of Tier 2 social housing. This research emerged during a project I was undertaking in York - after further research, I believe that this lack of housing in Tier 2 is not confined to York. Indeed, lack of social housing is merely reflective of the national problem of a lack of affordable housing for all. According to Shelter England, nearly 41,000 households with dependent children were living in temporary accommodation at the end of December 2012. This was before even the worst of austerity. Waiting lists for social housing are long and the vulnerable need affordable housing now!

attributes.action: Motor no-claims bonuses to be gained by claim-free years. not type of motor.
attributes.background: It should be illigal to allow a clause that legally allows companies to charge more money, because they won't recognize no-claims bonuses gained from driving Taxis/Vans/HGV/PSV etc.
attributes.additional_details: I have over 20 years of acciden- free driving gained on HGVs, PSVs, Ambulances and Taxis, yet any car insurance company will only allow no-claims gained with a car. Thus costing more money. LEGAL THEFT.

attributes.action: Make it Mandatory for Religious Schools/Groups to have Child protection policies
attributes.background: Having worked in a Faith setting myself and being aware of local Madrasah’s which do not have Child protection policies in place I am concerned about young people who attend such places. When I have personally approached the leaders of such places I have been turned away in good faith.
attributes.additional_details: Faith groups which run after school need to be registered on a Regional/National database and some ground rules need to be put in place by the relevant statutory body to help monitor the progress and  implementation of basic rights of the young people who attend these places of worship for religious education/activities. Certain Faith groups are not concerned with the bureaucracy of Child protection and sometimes cultural and religious pride plays a big part in this innocence.

attributes.action: We DEMAND an OFFICIAL APOLOGY from Parliament to The Continent of Africa
attributes.background:
For 300 years starting with Drake and Hawkins in the 16th century, Millions of young West Africans (Africa's most valuable asset) were illegally, immorally and unethically forcibly transported to British Slave Plantations.

https://www.facebook.com/Queen.Nanny/posts/10155348215317494:0
attributes.additional_details: Around 15 million enslaved West Africans perished as a direct result of the Middle passage and on Horrorifc plantations in the Caribbean. This does not include 350 years of Rape, torture, interbreeding, confinement, enslavement, wrongful and illegal transportation of West African citizens. The pain does not stop there, the vestiges of your odious and unequal system persists today, the descendants of slavery still continue to deal with your lust for money and genocide against African people.

attributes.action: Recognise the importance of citizens' access to encryption
attributes.background: The government must recognise the personal and economic benefits to encryption, and that any backdoor into WhatsApp cannot remain exclusive to GCHQ, but would soon become known to foreign intelligence services or criminal groups.
attributes.additional_details: Home Secretary and Europol are demanding companies such as WhatsApp to install backdoors so that security services may read suspected terrorists' messages. (Times, 27.03.17) The UK government may have 'noble' aims, but any backdoor would soon be found by the Russian or Chinese intelligence services. This would make the UK vulnerable to economic espionage, and have a chilling impact on dissidents in those countries. It could also be exploited by groups such as Anonymous, which may use intercepted messages to harass vulnerable groups such as LGBT+ people. T

attributes.action: Provide humanitarian assistance to Peru to help those affected by flooding
attributes.background: Provide comprehensive and timely assistance to help those affected by catastrophic flooding across Peru. At least 78 people have already been confirmed dead and approximately 640,000 have been displaced. Urgent support is needed to prevent further casualties and the outbreak of preventable diseases.
attributes.additional_details: The European Commission has mobilised €250,000 for emergency relief in Peru. While this is an important move, it is nowhere near sufficient for dealing with the catastrophic crisis that is already affecting hundreds of thousands of people and will affect many more. These floods will have even more devastating impacts unless the international community provides an adequate and timely response to reinforce the national effort. Safe drinking water, food and medical assistance is urgently required.

attributes.action: Do not allow the media to publicise the name of any terrorist attacker.
attributes.background: Stop the media from using the names of anyone who has carried out a terrorist attack, unless they are at liberty and need to be caught. Publicising terrorists gives them notoriety & encourages copycat attacks. Let's hear more about the heroes who stopped them or helped in the aftermath.

attributes.action: Limit Principal Private Residence Relief so the Rich pay Tax on their home sale.
attributes.background: Principal Private Residence Relief means noone has to pay Tax on the profit they make when they sell their home.  This also means the Rich can make £millions when they sell their home and not pay tax at all, at the same time that the Housing Crisis is the biggest social issue our country faces.

attributes.action: Make Dyslexia a recognised disability
attributes.background: Dyslexia is seen as a learning 'difficulty'. A disability is quoted as Someone who has a long term physical or mental impairment that disrupts their day to day activities. Reading, writing and spelling for many is a day to day activity. Also sufferers should receive funding for their disability.

attributes.action: The reinstatement of sedition and seditious libel as criminal offences.
attributes.background:
I believe that sedition and seditious libel should be reinstated as criminal offences into UK law. 

Sedition is defined as conduct or speech inciting people to rebel against the authority of a state or monarch.
attributes.additional_details:
Enemies of the United Kingdom are free to burn our flag and incite hatred against the crown, its authorities and the population of our union of countries, whilst fully aware that they are completely protected by our very own freedom of speech laws. This is unnaceptable, and should be a punishable offence. 
People such as Anjem Choudary should not have been able to spread such vile hatred for so long, whilst the crown prosecution were unable to do nothing to stop it.

attributes.action: Make road over-bridges safe, to reduce suicide attempts and road closures
attributes.background: Road closures cause an incredible cost to the economy and misery to thousands of motorists and businesses. Closures due to an individual the wrong side of a barrier and threatening to jump / or has jumped are needless and I believe avoidable.  Their frequency is astonishing, ask Highways England/Dft
attributes.additional_details: I strongly reassure that this petition is not aimed at apportioning blame for mental health issues; its aim is to dramatically reduce risk to those individuals and at same time limit the awful and costly impact to the travelling public and business. Some such incidents are for legitimate mental health issues and some are done to be deliberately disruptive. To mitigate risks and impact, install barriers that discourage and impede such behaviour so public can’t access or scale barriers naturally.

attributes.action: Do not deport refugees to countries that have abused them
attributes.background: From today (15 March) the exemptions to the Dublin Regulation - the EU law governing the transfer of asylum seekers - run out. People who have suffered extreme trauma will be sent to countries that they claim have mistreated and abused them. Parliament should not allow this to happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Struggling Southern European states are disproportionately allocated asylum seekers, which remains the case even when countries are linked to serious allegations of violence against refugees. There is also a risk that the threat of deportation causes migrants in the UK to become undocumented. 

We are calling on the Government to suspend Dublin transfers and allow residents with connections here to stay. 

You can read our report here: https://www.scribd.com/document/341947352/Roads-to-Nowhere

attributes.action: Introduce a higher rate of capital gains tax for properties left empty for years
attributes.background: With low interest rates and a weak pound, foreign ownership of properties in London has sky rocketed. This has forced up prices so that most people cannot afford to buy a house. Worse still many properties are left empty for years to accumulate in value when then forces up rents elsewhere as well.
attributes.additional_details: Introducing a scaled higher rate of capital gains tax for properties left empty for the majority of the duration of ownership would incentivise owners to rent them out, thus easing the strain on the already overheated rental market.

attributes.action: Car insurance prices shouldn't change from postcode to postcode
attributes.background: For instance, BT11 and BT17 insurance prices are very very high at around £5000 a year because they were associated with a bad reputation in the past. However, times have changed, and young drivers nowadays are more mature when it comes to owning a car and insurance.

attributes.action: Change the Examination System for Mathematics in the UK
attributes.background: My daughter had five attempts at passing her GCSE Mathematics and I see from TV reports that many children are struggling to pass leaving us with a generation of children who may never pass due to the rigours of the examination containing techniques that none of us ever use again.
attributes.additional_details: Why don't we have one exam containing addition, multiplication, subtraction and division for the less able students allowing them to at least leave school with a qualification and a more in depth exam for those wishing to study mathematics or wish careers where complicated maths is needed. Even my sons maths tutor could not finish the higher GCSE exam and he has a degree in maths. Why doesn't the government take notice of what is happening -  The Exam system is broken.

attributes.action: Premier League Football to be transmitted 'free to air' in England and Wales
attributes.background: Since the dawn of the 'Premier League Era', the industry now generates revenues in excess of £3.3bn. One could argue, with such a highly profitable industry, the 'Governing Bodies' and 'Broadcasters' could facilitate free to air games in their respective domestic leagues without suffering huge loss.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36412394 (Wilson, 2016)
https://www.theguardian.com/media/2016/aug/08/premier-league-tv-rights-virgin-media-premiership-price Cites Ofcom research into match day attendance and viewer figures, (Sweney, 2016)
https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/Deloitte/uk/Documents/sports-business-group/deloitte-uk-annual-review-of-football-finance-2016.pdf (Boor et al. 2016)

attributes.action: Make law and politics a core study in high school; like maths, English & science
attributes.background:
As the popular proverb suggests "knowledge is power."Thus, it seems to me our electorate is powerless! 

We complain about the turnout for elections and that people don't really understand the political and legal systems (especially 18 to 24s). So let's do something about it
attributes.additional_details:
Quite often in elections less than 50% of young people between the ages of 18 & 24 actually vote. Furthermore, it is often less than 70% of eligible voters who actually vote. 

In the general election 2015, 43% of 18 to 24s voted and only 66% of all eligible voters cast a vote. This is not good enough. 

https://www.ipsos-mori.com/researchpublications/researcharchive/3575/How-Britain-voted-in-2015.aspx

attributes.action: Replace the unelected House of Lords with a system comparable with jury service
attributes.background: Replacing the unelected House of Lords with a system comparable with a 'jury service' will enable Bills to be scrutinized apolitically thus ensuring laws can be passed or rejected on face value. No direct political loyalty should be allowed in an attempt to depoliticise the 'upper house'.

attributes.action: Immediately remove license from ALL drivers if caught on  Phone while driving
attributes.background: Remove license with £200 fine for all drivers caught on phone

attributes.action: Make Care Leavers Exempt From Housing Benefit Cuts OR Provide Adequate Housing
attributes.background: Care leavers are seven times more likely to die before they hit 21!! And those who don't are highly likely to go onto offending, substance misuse, violent relationships and poor mental health etc due to the lack of support. Stop setting these young people up to fail!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.disabledgo.com/blog/2017/02/early-deaths-among-care-leavers-revealed/#.WL8HXcjfWJJ
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-33551256
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/37363544
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2015/jul/07/care-leavers-sucked-into-crime
http://www.barnardos.org.uk/get_involved/corporate_partnerships/barnardos-in-business/care_leavers__set_up_to_fail_.htm

attributes.action: Provide funding to food banks to help supply appropriate food to ethnic groups
attributes.background: There is currently a regional situation whereby food bank charities would not supply appropriate food to multiple different ethnic groups’ requirements, such as Halal. This needs the government's backing as the health of this country's community, can not be left as the responsibility of charities.

attributes.action: Do a 3 month trial of letting people choose what their tax gets paid on.
attributes.background: Letting people choose what their tax gets paid on each month may help us feel more positive about the amount of tax we pay.

attributes.action: Ban all Americans from the UK until Donald Trump's Muslim Ban is revoked.
attributes.background:
Donald Trump has imposed a disgusting ban on people from majority Muslim nations under the guise of a national security issue despite the fact that no terrorist attack on American soil has originated in those countries. 

We ask that all Americans be banned until Trump realises his error.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of this is to implore the government to make a strong statement that Britain is against islamophobic policies and communicate this to Steve Bannon & Donald Trump in a language that they cannot ignore.

attributes.action: Make schools teach the dangers of using drugs and alcohol
attributes.background: Children become curious from a young age because not enough is being taught about this stuff in schools but like sex education they should be playing Video clips of the reality of what can happen when you take drugs and drink heavily, A once a week lesson in this could change many children's minds.

attributes.action: Full time students should be included in the 30hrs free childcare for 3-4yr olds
attributes.background: Currently parents working full time are entitled to 30hours free childcare for 3-4yr olds,whilst students are entitled to only 15hrs.The cost of childcare has to be funded by grants and loans,there isn't enough money to cover basic living and childcare.Childcare should not be a barrier to learning.

attributes.action: Share/Stakeholder,hedge fund,& companies using robots should pay social care tax
attributes.background: Share/stake holders who receive over £50,000 in dividends, hedge funds, and companies that replace workers with automation often fail to reinvest their profits in the workforce and payrates. As the workforce pays taxes, these companies are also depriving the Government of taxes and NI contributions.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should therefore introduce a new 'Social care tax' on share and stake holders, hedge funds, and companies who use automation. The Government must only use this income for social care.  It would help county councils tackle shortages in their social care budgets without making cuts elsewhere, including council tax rises. This tax would also help the NHS with their budget sort falls.

attributes.action: Bring back 10 boxes of fags
attributes.background: I want the government to remove the law that states 10 boxes of fags and menthols carnt be sold

attributes.action: Introduce same-sex civil partnership in British Consulate-General in Hong Kong
attributes.background: Civil Partnership (Registration Abroad and Certificates) Order 2005 states that all British nationals (BN(O) inclusive) are allowed to register civil partnerships with some British consulates/embassies abroad. There is no such service in HK due to the lack of consensus between the two governments.
attributes.additional_details:
The 5th term of the Chief Executive, which is the highest office of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR), will be elected on 26 March 2017.

It appears to be a golden opportunity for the Consul General to Hong Kong & Macao, Andrew Heyn OBE, to re-negotiate with the newly-elected HK government officials with regard to the provision of same-sex civil partnership registration service at the British Consulate-General in Hong Kong.

attributes.action: Ban the delivery of charity collection bags to households in the U.K.
attributes.background: Large plastic charity bags, wrapped in plastic envelopes are delivered to thousands of households in the U.K. every week. Only a tiny percentage are filled for collection with the majority ending-up straight in the homeowners bin and off to landfill. This unnecessary use of plastic bags must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
It is believed that 500,000 plastic charity collection bags are sent to landfill every year. Each bag is delivered inside yet another plastic bag envelope meaning some one million bags are disposed of in our landfill sites around the country every year, via doorstep delivery.
Most local council recycling stations, as well as many towns and villages retain clothing bins and can be freely used to dispose of such unwanted goods easily and without the need for such large scale waste.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of non-rescue cats and dogs In pet stores.
attributes.background:
San Francisco enacted a new law stating that pet shops can only sell cats and dogs that come from rescue centres.

Let's follow in their footsteps to ensure that rescued animals find a home before dogs and cats are needlessly bred for profit!
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015, the RSPCA alone rescued and collected 118,994 animals. In the same year, 5,142 had to be put down because of overcrowding in shelters and lack of resources. 

We, the people of the UK, request a law that will ensure that pet stores will help find homes for the hundreds of thousands of dogs and cats left to be forgotten BEFORE breeding more!

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsround/39004663

http://www.express.co.uk/news/nature/609353/The-Dogs-Trust-stray-dog-crisis-in-UK

attributes.action: Charge cyclists road tax and insurance,require to have side mirrors by law
attributes.background: Cyclists causes accidents ,damages and hold us drivers up . They should pay insurance in case they damage cars or are involved in rtc.they use our roads so they should pay some  road tax! Accidents could be prevented if riders were required to use Mirrors so they don't just pull out in front of us!
attributes.additional_details: They cause traffic ques. They have hold us up and we pay to use the road ...

attributes.action: All government agencies to stop using marital status titles for women
attributes.background:
All government agencies to stop using marital status for women.

Current marital status title's for women: Miss – unmarried Mrs – married Ms – divorced 

Propose to replace with Ms only to indicate a female. 
This is aligned with Mr to indicate a male.
attributes.additional_details:
A women's place in society is no longer dictated by her marital status. 

Requesting marital status on all applications/forms has no relevance and the government agencies should update this archaic practise and be brought in line and equal with men, where only a gender acknowledgement is required.

attributes.action: Conduct a full review into Business Rates to make them fairer to small business.
attributes.background: The upcoming revaluation of business rates will result in crippling increases to some small businesses already struggling to compete with online retailers. We call upon the government to postpone the revaluation until a full review has been carried out and the sytem made fairer to small business.
